cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northeast today, then turning northeast and accelerating toward the northwest Florida Big-Bend coast and subsequently across Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Northwest Florida Big Bend (near Indian Pass–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast from Aripeka to Indian Pass, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (4%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained winds expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Mobile, AL as surge threat is focused east of the Big Bend.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–2 inches of rain, locally higher in showers.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk and minor lightning from outer bands; operational disruption minimal but monitor for squalls.
